./security-guide/section_hypervisor-selection.xml714(para)#: ./security-guide/section_hypervisor-selection.xml719(para)#: ./security-guide/ch_instance-management.xml9(para) msgid "" "One of the virtues of running instances in a virtualized environment is that" " it opens up new opportunities for security controls that are not typically " "available when deploying onto bare metal. There are several technologies " "that can be applied to the virtualization stack that bring improved " "information assurance for cloud tenants." msgstr "仮想環境でインスタンスを運用する長所の一つは、ベアメタルで配備した際には利用できないセキュリティ管理方法の選択肢が増えることです。仮想スタック上のクラウドテナントの情報管理を改善する技術は多数存在します。" #: ./security-guide/ch_instance-management.xml16(para) msgid "" "Deployers or users of OpenStack with strong security requirements may want " "to consider deploying these technologies. Not all are applicable in every " "situation, indeed in some cases technologies may be ruled out for use in a " "cloud because of prescriptive business requirements. Similarly some " "technologies inspect instance data such as run state which may be " "undesirable to the users of the system." msgstr "高いセキュリティ要件を持つOpenStackユーザーや配備者はこれらの技術の採用を検討すると良いかもしれませんが、状況によっては適用できない場合があります。クラウド運用においては、規範的なビジネス要件のために技術の選択肢が削られることがあります。また、run stateなど、仕組みによってはインスタンス内のデータを調べる機構もあり、システムのユーザーからは好まれないものもあります。" #: ./security-guide/ch_instance-management.xml24(para) msgid "" "In this chapter we explore these technologies and describe the situations " "where they can be used to enhance security for instances or underlying " "instances. We also seek to highlight where privacy concerns may exist. These" " include data pass through, introspection, or providing a source of entropy." " In this section we highlight the following additional security services:" msgstr "本章では、これらの仕組みの詳細とどのような状況においてインスタンスのセキュリティが向上されるかを説明します。また、プライバシー観点における懸念箇所にも焦点をあてます。データのパススルー、イントロスペクション、またエントロピー元の提供などが該当します。本セクションでは、下記のセキュリティサービスに焦点を当てます:" #: ./security-guide/ch_instance-management.xml33(para) #: ./security-guide/section_security-services-for-instances.xml10(title) msgid "Entropy to instances" msgstr "インスタンスへのエントロピー" #: ./security-guide/ch_instance-management.xml38(para) #: ./security-guide/section_security-services-for-instances.xml46(title) msgid "Scheduling instances to nodes" msgstr "ノードへのインスタンスのスケジューリング" #: ./security-guide/ch_instance-management.xml43(para) #: ./security-guide/section_security-services-for-instances.xml125(title) msgid "Trusted images" msgstr "信頼されたイメージ" #: ./security-guide/ch_instance-management.xml48(para) #: ./security-guide/section_security-services-for-instances.xml200(title) msgid "Instance migrations" msgstr "インスタンスのマイグレーション" #: ./security-guide/ch_instance-management.xml53(para) #: ./security-guide/section_security-services-for-instances.xml272(title) msgid "Monitoring, alerting, and reporting" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/ch_instance-management.xml58(para) #: ./security-guide/section_security-services-for-instances.xml301(title) msgid "Updates and patches" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/ch_instance-management.xml63(para) #: ./security-guide/section_security-services-for-instances.xml319(title) msgid "Firewalls and other host-based security controls" msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/ch_compliance.xml9(para) msgid "" "An OpenStack deployment may require compliance activities for many purposes," " such as regulatory and legal requirements, customer need, privacy " "considerations, and security best practices. The Compliance function is " "important for the business and its customers. Compliance means adhering to " "regulations, specifications, standards and laws. It is also used when " "describing an organizations status regarding assessments, audits, and " "certifications. Compliance, when done correctly, unifies and strengthens the" " other security topics discussed in this guide." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/ch_compliance.xml20(para) msgid "This chapter has several objectives:" msgstr "この章の目的は以下の通りです。" #: ./security-guide/ch_compliance.xml25(para) msgid "Review common security principles." msgstr "共通のセキュリティ原則を確認する" #: ./security-guide/ch_compliance.xml30(para) msgid "" "Discuss common control frameworks and certification resources to achieve " "industry certifications or regulator attestations." msgstr "業界認定や監督当局の認証を得るために必要な、共通コントロールフレームワークと認定リソースを説明する" #: ./security-guide/ch_compliance.xml36(para) msgid "Act as a reference for auditors when evaluating OpenStack deployments." msgstr "監査人がOpenStack環境を評価する際のリファレンスとなる" #: ./security-guide/ch_compliance.xml42(para) msgid "" "Introduce privacy considerations specific to OpenStack and cloud " "environments." msgstr "OpenStackおよびクラウド環境におけるプライバシーの考慮事項を説明する" #: ./security-guide/section_compliance-overview.xml158(para)"A lot of activity goes on within a cloud environment. It is a mix of " "hardware, operating systems, virtual machine managers, the OpenStack " "services, cloud-user activity such as creating instances and attaching " "storage, the network underlying the whole, and finally end-users using the " "applications running on the various instances." msgstr "多数の活動がクラウド環境内で行われます。これはハードウェア、オペレーティングシステム、仮想マシンマネージャ、OpenStackサービス群、インスタンス作成やストレージアタッチのようなクラウド⇔ユーザ活動、全体の土台であるネットワーク、最後に様々なインスタンス上で実行されるアプリケーションを使用するエンドユーザのミックスです。" #: ./security-guide/section_forensics-and-incident-response.xml17(para) msgid ""#: ./security-guide/section_forensics-and-incident-response.xml25(para) msgid "" "The basics of logging: configuration, setting log level, location of the log" " files, and how to use and customize logs, as well as how to do centralized " "collections of logs is well covered in the <link " "href=\"http://docs.openstack.org/ops/\"><citetitle>OpenStack Operations " "Guide</citetitle></link>." msgstr "ロギングの基本: ログを集中収集する方法と同様、設定、ログレベル設定、ログファイルの位置、ログの使用とカスタマイズ方法は、<link href=\"http://docs.openstack.org/ops/\"><citetitle>OpenStack Operations Guide</citetitle></link> で充分にカバーされています。" #: ./security-guide/section_forensics-and-incident-response.xml33(para)#: Multiple factors should be considered when " "deciding on a database server, however for the scope of this book only " "security considerations will be discussed. OpenStack supports PostgreSQL and" " MySQL database types." msgstr "" #: ./security-guide/section_database-backend-considerations.xml10(para) msgid ""#: ./security-guide/section_database-backend-considerations.xml11(para)#: ./security-guide/section_database-backend-considerations.xml13(title)#: ./security-guide/section_database-backend-considerations.xml14(para)#: ./security-guide/section_database-backend-considerations.xml15(para)#: ./security-guide/section_database-backend-considerations.xml17(link)#: ./security-guide/section_database-backend-considerations.xml20(link)#: ./security-guide/section_database-backend-considerations.xml23(link)#: ./security-guide/section_database-backend-considerations.xml26(para)#: ./security-guide/section_database-backend-considerations.xml28(link)#: ./security-guide/section_database-backend-considerations.xml31(link)#: ./security-guide/section_hypervisor-selection.xml491(td)#: ./security-guide/section_data-privacy-concerns.xml31(para)#: ./security-guide/section_hypervisor-selection.xml13(para) msgid "" "Virtualization can provide flexibility, improved resource utilization, " "faster provisioning, and other benefits that enable cloud computing. ./security-guide/section_hypervisor-selection.xml728(para)#: ./security-guide/section_data-privacy-concerns.xml9(para) msgid "" "OpenStack is designed to support multitenancy and those tenants will most " "probably have different data requirements. As a cloud builder and operator " "you need to ensure your OpenStack environment can address various data " "privacy concerns and regulations. In this chapter we will address the " "following topics around Data Privacy as it pertains to OpenStack " "implementations:" msgstr "OpenStack はマルチテナンシーをサポートするよう設計されており、これらのテナントには、まず間違いなく異なるデータ要件があるでしょう。クラウド構築者とオペレータとして、あなたは自身の OpenStack 環境が様々なデータプライバシー関連と規制を扱える事を確認する必要があります。OpenStack 実装に関連するので、本章ではデータプライバシーにまつわる以下のトピックを扱います。" #: ./security-guide/section_security-services-for-instances.xml134(None)#: ./security-guide/section_security-services-for-instances.xml9(para) msgid "" "One of the virtues of running instances in a virtualized environment is that" " it opens up new opportunities for security controls that are not typically " "available when deploying onto bare metal. There are several technologies " "that can be applied to the virtualization stack that bring improved " "information assurance for cloud tenants." msgstr "仮想環境でインスタンスを運用する長所の一つは、ベアメタルで配備した際には利用できないセキュリティ管理方法の選択肢が増えることです。仮想スタック上のクラウドテナントの情報管理を改善する技術は多数存在します。" #: ./security-guide/section_security-services-for-instances.xml10(para) msgid "" "Deployers or users of OpenStack with strong security requirements may want " "to consider deploying these technologies. Not all are applicable in every " "situation, indeed in some cases technologies may be ruled out for use in a " "cloud because of prescriptive business requirements. Similarly some " "technologies inspect instance data such as run state which may be " "undesirable to the users of the system." msgstr "高いセキュリティ要件を持つOpenStackユーザーや配備者はこれらの技術の採用を検討すると良いかもしれませんが、状況によっては適用できない場合があります。クラウド運用においては、規範的なビジネス要件のために技術の選択肢が削られることがあります。また、run stateなど、仕組みによってはインスタンス内のデータを調べる機構もあり、システムのユーザーからは好まれないものもあります。" "In this chapter we explore these technologies and describe the situations " "where they can be used to enhance security for instances or underlying " "instances. We also seek to highlight where privacy concerns may exist. These" " include data pass through, introspection, or providing a source of entropy." " In this section we highlight the following additional security services:" msgstr "本章では、これらの仕組みの詳細とどのような状況においてインスタンスのセキュリティが向上されるかを説明します。また、プライバシー観点における懸念箇所にも焦点をあてます。データのパススルー、イントロスペクション、またエントロピー元の提供などが該当します。本セクションでは、下記のセキュリティサービスに焦点を当てます:" #: ./security-guide/section_security-services-for-instances.xml13(para) #: ./security-guide/section_security-services-for-instances.xml35(title) msgid "Entropy to instances" msgstr "インスタンスへのエントロピー" #: Change-Id: I431df44e0fed4a981df96a9a98bfbb5c350e49ac

commit_message:
Check for root privilege in start.sh

This change was lost in 888bb9cc8c68bf61fddc0ca08a69f764a4012121.
Both modprobe and setenforce require root, so I think this is a good
sanity check.

Change-Id: I431df44e0fed4a981df96a9a98bfbb5c350e49ac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/09/166509/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ $EUID -ne 0 ]]; then echo "You must execute this script as root." 1>&2 exit 1 fi

commit_message:
EMC: Fix use of "_" as variable name

Variables with name "_" will clash with translation lookup
function "_" in cinder.i18n. This patch fixes usage of "_"
as variable name.

- Moved all text above section references

Change-Id: Ifb86631033aad1ca622be9cf3c3677293d8c56bd

commit_message:
Ensure thread-safety of persistence dir backend

Even though this backend is protected by process locks
against other processes we still need to protect against
threads in the same process; so to do this grab a write
lock and use it in the same manner that the memory backend
does; as a per-backend write-lock.

Change-Id: Ifb86631033aad1ca622be9cf3c3677293d8c56bd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/17/166417/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.lock = lock_utils.ReaderWriterLock() """This just wraps a global write-lock.""" lock = self.backend.lock.write_lock with lock(): yield

commit_message:
Use binary/encode decode helper routines in dir backend

Instead of using smaller versions of those routines just
call into the same helper routines that the rest of the
code uses.

This also allows that backend to take a configuration
option that specifies the encoding that will be used for
when translating unicode strings into binary (and vice
versa); this defaults to utf-8 to retain the existing
behavior.

Change-Id: Icfcbb22310e163753d8b34af212efc166c82634b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/67/165667/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.encoding = self._conf.get('encoding', 'utf-8') cache_info['data'] = misc.binary_decode( fp.read(), encoding=self.backend.encoding) contents = misc.binary_encode(contents, encoding=self.backend.encoding)
deleted_lines: cache_info['data'] = fp.read().decode('utf-8') if isinstance(contents, six.text_type): contents = contents.encode('utf-8')

subject: Reduce configured file size for nfs backup unit tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-18 12:44:15.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/backup/drivers/test_backup_nfs.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/7cdcb7ac63ede192af4639675bf21e80c2a3a752', 'message': "Reduce configured file size for nfs backup unit tests

Unit tests that were ported from the Swift backup
service for NFS backup trigger memory errors when
run in tox on a 1GB VM.  This commit configures
NFS backup 'backup_file_size' to match the default
Swift 'chunk_size' so that the NFS backup unit test
memory consumption is dialed down to match the Swift
unit tests.

Closes-Bug: 1432687

Change-Id: I4b71d47190179b97baefe9bc390276f720670919
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce configured file size for nfs backup unit tests

Unit tests that were ported from the Swift backup
service for NFS backup trigger memory errors when
run in tox on a 1GB VM.  This commit configures
NFS backup 'backup_file_size' to match the default
Swift 'chunk_size' so that the NFS backup unit test
memory consumption is dialed down to match the Swift
unit tests.

Closes-Bug: 1432687

Change-Id: I4b71d47190179b97baefe9bc390276f720670919
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/94/165394/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.override_config('backup_file_size', 52428800) self.volume_file.seek(16 * 1024) self.volume_file.seek(20 * 1024) # Verify that two shas are changed at index 16 and 20 self.assertNotEqual(content1['sha256s'][20], content2['sha256s'][20])
deleted_lines: return self.volume_file.seek(2 * 8 * 1024) self.volume_file.seek(4 * 8 * 1024) # Verify that two shas are changed at index 16 and 32 self.assertNotEqual(content1['sha256s'][32], content2['sha256s'][32])

commit_message:
Don't kill keystone, but instead wait for it to finish at the end

use the bash wait builtin to wait for the keystone process to exit.

Change-Id: I03057e7925e7e41120c163c0be22ade75050d9f1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/30/166330/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Wait on all jobs to exit before proceeding (see man wait) wait
deleted_lines: # Stop Keystone service echo "Stopping Keystone for changes to take effect." kill -TERM $PID # Check to make sure the service is stopped echo "Making sure the Keystone service is stopped." while curl -o /dev/null -s --fail ${SERVICE_ENDPOINT}; do echo "waiting for keystone @ ${SERVICE_ENDPOINT} to exit" sleep 1; done # Start Keystone again for final changes to take effect echo "Running keystone service." exec /usr/bin/keystone-all

commit_message:
Fix `wait_for` function in kolla-common.sh

Add `wait_for_output` and `wait_for_output_unless` helper functions that
only succeed when the command output contains the expected string, with
a possibility to exit early with a failure for `wait_for_output_unless`.

Change-Id: Ie20e7c72fb84f626f1a3fe9c4d2f22c9d6863dbe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/99/165699/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The usage of the wait_for function looks like the following # wait_for LOOPS_NUMBER SLEEP_TIME ARGS # # The ARGS are read and concatenated together into a single command and the # command is executed in a loop until it succeeds or reaches the max number of # attempts (LOOPS_NUMBER). # # Optional variables SUCCESSFUL_MATCH_OUTPUT and FAIL_MATCH_OUTPUT variable may # also be set to control if the loop exits early if the commands stdout/stderr # matches the supplied regex string. Consider using the `wait_for_output` and # `wait_for_output_unless` functions in case there is a need to check for the # command output. # # Examples: # wait_for 30 10 ping -c 1 192.0.2.2 # wait_for 10 1 ls file_we_are_waiting_for # wait_for 10 3 date \| grep 8 FAIL_MATCH_OUTPUT=${FAIL_MATCH_OUTPUT:-""} SUCCESSFUL_MATCH_OUTPUT=${SUCCESSFUL_MATCH_OUTPUT:-""} echo "wait_for is missing a required parameter" return 1 if [[ -n "$SUCCESSFUL_MATCH_OUTPUT" ]] \ && [[ $output =~ $SUCCESSFUL_MATCH_OUTPUT ]]; then return 0 elif [[ -n "$FAIL_MATCH_OUTPUT" ]] \ && [[ $output =~ $FAIL_MATCH_OUTPUT ]]; then echo "Command output matched '$FAIL_MATCH_OUTPUT'." return 1 elif [[ -z "$SUCCESSFUL_MATCH_OUTPUT" ]] && [[ $status -eq 0 ]]; then return 0 return 1 } # Helper function to `wait_for` that only succeeds when the given regex is # matching the command's output. Exit early with a failure when the second # supplied regexp is matching the output. # # Example: # wait_for_output_unless CREATE_COMPLETE CREATE_FAIL 30 10 heat stack-show undercloud wait_for_output_unless() { SUCCESSFUL_MATCH_OUTPUT=$1 FAIL_MATCH_OUTPUT=$2 shift 2 wait_for $@ local status=$? unset SUCCESSFUL_MATCH_OUTPUT unset FAIL_MATCH_OUTPUT return $status } # Helper function to `wait_for` that only succeeds when the given regex is # matching the command's output. # # Example: # wait_for_output CREATE_COMPLETE 30 10 heat stack-show undercloud wait_for_output() { local expected_output=$1 shift wait_for_output_unless $expected_output '' $@
deleted_lines: local fail_match_output=${fail_match_output:-""} local successful_match_output=${successful_match_output:-""} echo "Incorrect call of wait_for. Refer to docs/wait-for.md for help" if [[ -n "$successful_match_output" ]] \ && [[ $output =~ $successful_match_output ]]; then break elif [[ -n "$fail_match_output" ]] \ && [[ $output =~ $fail_match_output ]]; then echo "Command output matched '$fail_match_output'." continue elif [[ -z "$successful_match_output" ]] && [[ $status -eq 0 ]]; then break exit 1

commit_message:
Refactors nwfilter

Previously, the nwfilter daemon/conf pkgs would need to be
installed on the host. Compose would then mount the host DIR
to the compute containers. A more efficient approach is to simply
install the nwfilter config/daemon in the libvirt container. Both
appoaches address the following error when booting an instance:

'no-mac-spoofing' is missing

Change-Id: I81b446d198920473bf99b97ef5eac6ef5ee85024
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/95/166395/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add pid: host to libvirt

Without pid: host, nova-compute and libvirt fail to operate correctly
together.  I don't understand why, and I wish it weren't so, but it means
folks will have to install docker-compose from my personal github account
until the pull request is merged upstream.

Change-Id: I24e55405139c831f2df246f54c5b6fd39d00656a

commit_message:
Remove reference to k8s directory from README

Kolla has moved away from Kubernetes and is now using docker-compose to
define container sets.

Remove last reference to Kubernetes in the README file, and document
the `compose` directory instead.

Change-Id: Ic586da2ae7859817c0da888f6ce5c788188e43d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/65/166065/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * compose - contains the docker-compose files defining the container sets
deleted_lines: * k8s - contains service and pod configuration information for Kubernetes

commit_message:
Display commands and use wget instead of instantiating image

Display commands to run so user understands what is happening.

Also use wget as it handles URL redirects.

Change-Id: I1f88ba2c385f5fa2250e2aac84290bdb0249d918
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/77/165677/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash# Set SELinux to permissive setenforce permissive # This directory is shared with the host to allow qemu instance # configs to remain accross restarts. This is needed in the event libvirt # is not installed in the system. mkdir -p /etc/libvirt/qemu# but you can't modprobe from a container for some reasonecho Starting rabbitmq. echo Starting mariadb.echo Starting keystone.echo Starting glance.echo Starting nova.echo Starting nova compute with nova networking. wget $IMAGE_URL/$IMAGEuntil keystone user-list | grep glance do echo "Waiting for OpenStack services to become available" sleep 2 done sleep 3 echo Example usage: echo echo glance image-create --name cirros --is-public true --disk-format qcow2 --container-format bare --file $IMAGE echo nova secgroup-add-rule default tcp 22 22 0.0.0.0/0 echo nova secgroup-add-rule default icmp -1 -1 0.0.0.0/0 echo nova network-create vmnet --fixed-range-v4=10.0.0.0/24 --bridge=br100 --multi-host=T echo echo nova keypair-add mykey > mykey.pem echo chmod 600 mykey.pem echo nova boot --flavor m1.medium --key_name mykey --image cirros kolla_vm
deleted_lines: #!/bin/bash -xsetenforce 0echo Starting rabbitmq and mariadbuntil mysql -u root --password=kolla --host=$MY_IP mysql -e "show tables;" do echo waiting for mysql.. sleep 3 done echo Starting keystoneuntil keystone user-list do echo waiting for keystone.. sleep 3 done echo Starting glanceecho Starting nova# I think we'll need this.. # # until mysql -u root --password=kolla --host=$MY_IP mysql -e "use nova;" # do # echo waiting for nova db. # sleep 3 # done echo "Waiting for nova-api to create keystone user.." until keystone user-list | grep nova do echo waiting for keystone nova user sleep 2 done # This directory is shared with the host to allow qemu instance # configs to remain accross restarts. mkdir -p /etc/libvirt/qemu echo Starting nova compute curl -o $IMAGE $IMAGE_URL/$IMAGEecho "Creating glance image.." glance image-create --name "puffy_clouds" --is-public true --disk-format qcow2 --container-format bare --file $IMAGE # Example usage: # # nova secgroup-add-rule default tcp 22 22 0.0.0.0/0 # nova secgroup-add-rule default icmp -1 -1 0.0.0.0/0 # nova network-create vmnet --fixed-range-v4=10.0.0.0/24 --bridge=br100 --multi-host=T # # nova keypair-add mykey > mykey.pem # chmod 600 mykey.pem # nova boot --flavor m1.medium --key_name mykey --image puffy_clouds newInstanceName

subject: spec: updates for rspec-puppet 2.x and rspec 3.x
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-16 02:08:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova/commit/f109469257d09134bd249541d58b00ffef628e4e', 'message': 'spec: updates for rspec-puppet 2.x and rspec 3.x

This patch aim to update our specs test in order to work with the
rspec-puppet release 2.0.0, in the mean time, we update rspec syntax
order to be prepared for rspec 3.x move.

In details:

 * Upgrade and pin rspec-puppet from 1.0.1 to 2.0.0
 * Use shared_examples "a Puppet::Error" for puppet::error tests *
 * Convert 'should' keyword to 'is_expected.to' (prepare rspec 3.x) *
 * Fix spec tests for rspec-puppet 2.0.0
 * Clean Gemfile (remove over-specificication of runtime deps of puppetlabs_spec_helper)

Change-Id: I172439c6ed185bb38b325b2524cab1475cdc7504
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-16 08:06:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova/commit/fca3cdf88ae0d935c2b68f87b6c9f0595216cac3', 'message': 'spec: updates for rspec-puppet 2.x and rspec 3.x

This patch aim to update our specs test in order to work with the
rspec-puppet release 2.0.0, in the mean time, we update rspec syntax
order to be prepared for rspec 3.x move.

In details:

 * Upgrade and pin rspec-puppet from 1.0.1 to 2.0.0
 * Use shared_examples "a Puppet::Error" for puppet::error tests *
 * Convert 'should' keyword to 'is_expected.to' (prepare rspec 3.x) *
 * Fix spec tests for rspec-puppet 2.0.0

commit_message:
spec: updates for rspec-puppet 2.x and rspec 3.x

This patch aim to update our specs test in order to work with the
rspec-puppet release 2.0.0, in the mean time, we update rspec syntax
order to be prepared for rspec 3.x move.

In details:

 * Upgrade and pin rspec-puppet from 1.0.1 to 2.0.0
 * Use shared_examples "a Puppet::Error" for puppet::error tests *
 * Convert 'should' keyword to 'is_expected.to' (prepare rspec 3.x) *
 * Fix spec tests for rspec-puppet 2.0.0
 * Clean Gemfile (remove over-specificication of runtime deps of puppetlabs_spec_helper)

Change-Id: I172439c6ed185bb38b325b2524cab1475cdc7504

commit_message:
Move to using the oslo.utils stop watch

The code was moved to the oslo.utils package
and we can now use it to avoid having our own type
that does the same thing (less duplicated code
and more sharing is good).

Change-Id: I0545a978083ced75b2ba99280569ca2370756d33

commit_message:
Implements: blueprint Implement a database container set

Previously, the database container was configured for use with
Kubernetes. This patch removed any k8s dependencies, adds a script
to manage mysql server.cnf settings and splits data and app
containers. Splitting the containers provides additional
portability and operational efficiencies compared to host mounts.

Change-Id: I80656450c02dda5f2959d187eec20d5877dc54a2

commit_message:
Speed up memcache lock

Simplify sleep timeouts calculation removing progressive scale.

Closes-bug: #1395688
Change-Id: I0f1b620df9631a4b081e8c0be93d8a9b2d60e105
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/49/136749/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for i in range(self.max_lock_attempts): sleep_time = random.random() raise exception.UnexpectedError( _('Maximum lock attempts on %s occurred.') % self.key)
deleted_lines: i = 0 while True: sleep_time = (((i + 1) * random.random()) + 2 ** i) / 2.5 if i <= self.max_lock_attempts: i += 1 else: raise exception.UnexpectedError( _('Maximum lock attempts on %s occurred.') % self.key)

commit_message:
Avoid re-using the same timeout for further watcher ops

Instead of re-using the same timeout that is passed into the
'run_watchers' function we should adjust that timeout after
each fetch so that the expected timeout the user gives to this
function is observed.

Change-Id: I5d171b1ac8b207213224f4e0f3909625de7275db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tooz refs/changes/98/151498/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[Launch Instance Fix] Remove outline from basic search bar

A name collision with Magic Search resulted in an outline
around the basic search bar in Launch Instance steps. This
patch renames the class for the basic search bar to
'basic-search-bar'.

Change-Id: If1676a7f78a4d7d9566aef853d58871b60b1a803
Closes-Bug: #1434661

commit_message:
Fix an issue on updating bay's node_count on DB

When using bay-update to scale the cluster, the node_count attribute of
bay doesn't get updated at DB. This is due to the 'delta' of Bay object
being unexpected removed. This patch is for fixing that by creating a
copy of delta.

Change-Id: Ia42f9a793fb94ee66c8a1cb1a72ef3061a4491bb
Closes-Bug: 1434145
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/00/166400/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add retry to create resource in Datera driver

If the volume is still in a creating state, wait, and retry a few times.
Otherwise, raise an exception for the manager to set the volume into an
error state.

Closes-Bug: #1433543
Change-Id: If49fd9229f08301cedbd63399fe46475e73a83ef

commit_message:
Bypass paste.deploy's loadcontext to read a config from a string

We need a good way to make a default config internal client work on
upgrades without a config on disk.  This would work until we can get
a patch upstream against paste.deploy that will accept a URI
object.

Change-Id: Ibeeb354bf67ef978aba99ac416aa9d10016b9893

added_lines: @with_tempdir def test_loadapp_from_file(self, tempdir): conf_path = os.path.join(tempdir, 'object-server.conf') conf_body = """ [app:main] use = egg:swift#object """ contents = dedent(conf_body) with open(conf_path, 'w') as f: f.write(contents) app = wsgi.loadapp(conf_path) self.assertTrue(isinstance(app, obj_server.ObjectController)) def test_loadapp_from_string(self): conf_body = """ [app:main] use = egg:swift#object """ app = wsgi.loadapp(wsgi.StringLikeConfig(conf_body)) self.assertTrue(isinstance(app, obj_server.ObjectController))

commit_message:
Improve create instance without volume service

Currently an error notification is raised when creating an instance
on an OpenStack deployment without volume service.

This change avoids the error notification as volume service is not
required to boot an instance.

Change-Id: I1dd601e7746dfdedc7568c1f3ba0036b327da18e
Closes-Bug: #1427261

commit_message:
Fix oslo caps for kilo

The ~= syntax isn't working with some of our tools (notably the job that
syncs the changes into projects), so switch back to expressing the range
the long way.

Change-Id: Ib9e3815f5bf5608ca9252fa1bfce099adb5869bc

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-20 16:14:49.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware/commit/3879e83ff685121a80eeb4cec577c551b0f77cd9', 'message': "Move pylint dependency to tox.ini

We do not run a gate job against oslo.vmware using pylint, so move the
dependency out of the synced requirements and into the tox environment
settings instead. If that's no longer useful, we can remove the tox
environment completely.

Change-Id: Ice3527b8d92137d04fd77e7e800a5875fa7fdaf2
"}]
commit_message:
Move pylint dependency to tox.ini

We do not run a gate job against oslo.vmware using pylint, so move the
dependency out of the synced requirements and into the tox environment
settings instead. If that's no longer useful, we can remove the tox
environment completely.

Change-Id: Ice3527b8d92137d04fd77e7e800a5875fa7fdaf2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware refs/changes/98/166298/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: deps = -r{toxinidir}/requirements.txt -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt pylint>=1.3.0

commit_message:
Source step - fix dynamic column headers and data

The source step of the Launch Instance Wizard contains a transfer
table which is dynamic in nature. The table's column headers and data
change based on the boot source that is selected. This patch fixes
the column headers and data mapping when a boot source is selected,
based on the latest Invision mockups (where valid).

Closes-Bug: 1432883

Change-Id: I2dd5d246471d12dd7a8c5287f1e5a6093a3c196f

subject: Add cleaning/zapping support to IPA
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-04 01:51:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent/commit/94eff135997e8b1223667907644580ba4c5e56ef', 'message': 'Add cleaning/zapping support to IPA

This will add support for in band cleaning operations to IPA and
replace the decom API that was unused.

Adds API support for get_clean_steps, which returns a list of
supported clean steps for the node, execute_clean_step, to execute
one of the steps returned by get_clean_steps.

Adds versioning and naming for hardware managers, so if a new hardware
manager version is deployed in the middle of cleaning/zapping, the
cleaning/zapping will be restarted to avoid incompatabilities.

Change-Id: I750b80b9bf98b3ddc5643bb4c14a67d2052239af

supported clean steps for the node, execute_clean_step, to execute
one of the steps returned by get_clean_steps.

Adds versioning and naming for hardware managers, so if a new hardware
manager version is deployed in the middle of cleaning/zapping, the

commit_message:
Add cleaning/zapping support to IPA

This will add support for in band cleaning operations to IPA and
replace the decom API that was unused.

Adds API support for get_clean_steps, which returns a list of
supported clean steps for the node, execute_clean_step, to execute
one of the steps returned by get_clean_steps.

Adds versioning and naming for hardware managers, so if a new hardware
manager version is deployed in the middle of cleaning/zapping, the
cleaning/zapping will be restarted to avoid incompatabilities.

blueprint implement-cleaning-states
blueprint inband-raid-configuration
blueprint implement-zaping-states
Depends-On: Ia2500ed5afb72058b4c5e8f41307169381cbce48
Change-Id: I750b80b9bf98b3ddc5643bb4c14a67d2052239af

commit_message:
Allow baymodel name when bay is created

Bay needs baymodel id when bay is created. But usually, user want to use
`baymodel name` instead of baymodel id.
This patch supports baymodel name when bay is created.

Eg. magnum bay-create --name bay1 --baymodel-id baymodel-name

Partially implements blueprint name-based-resource-management

Change-Id: I8c042c461d46a251c1cd6772979d77a95b902de5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/99/166099/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[Tempest]: Try to find py27 interpreter

Since Rally team wants to support all Python 2.6, Python 2.7 and Python 3
envs and based on way of launching tempest(Rally install Tempest in virtual
environment), we can try to find and select a suitable python interpreter
for Tempest(Tempest designed only for Python 2.7). It can allow to support
`rally verify` stuff in all python environments.

Change-Id: If8c94c28119a34e60c00f7ef2cb9b94bc2e62004

added_lines: python_executor = self.validate_env() or "python" try: check_output("%s ./tools/install_venv.py" % python_executor, shell=True, cwd=self.path()) eg: python2.7 if (2, 7) > sys.version_info > (2, 7): # NOTE(andreykurilin): let's try to find a suitable version python_versions = [] paths = os.environ.get("PATH", "").split(":") for p in paths: all_files = [os.path.join(p, f) for f in os.listdir(p)] python_versions.extend( [f for f in all_files if f.find("/python2.7") > -1 and f.find("config") == -1]) if not len(python_versions): raise exceptions.IncompatiblePythonVersion( version=sys.version_info) else: LOG.info(_("%s") % python_versions[0]) return python_versions[0]
deleted_lines: self.validate_env() try: check_output("python ./tools/install_venv.py", shell=True, cwd=self.path()) eg: python>2.7 if sys.version_info < (2, 7): raise exceptions.IncompatiblePythonVersion( version=sys.version_info)

added_lines: @base.atomic_action_timer("keystone.create_role") def _role_create(self, name_length=5): """Creates keystone user role with random name. :param name_length: length of generated (random) part of role name :returns: keystone user role instance """ role = self.admin_clients("keystone").roles.create( self._generate_random_name(length=name_length)) return role @base.atomic_action_timer("keystone.service_list") def _list_services(self): """List services.""" return self.admin_clients("keystone").services.list() @base.atomic_action_timer("keystone.get_tenant") def _get_tenant(self, tenant): """Get given tenant. :param tenant: tenant object """ self.admin_clients("keystone").tenants.get(tenant.id) @base.atomic_action_timer("keystone.get_user") def _get_user(self, user): """Get given user. :param user: user object """ self.admin_clients("keystone").users.get(user.id) @base.atomic_action_timer("keystone.get_role") def _get_role(self, role): """Get given user role. :param role: user role object """ self.admin_clients("keystone").roles.get(role.id) @base.atomic_action_timer("keystone.get_service") def _get_service(self, service_id): """Get service with given service id. :param service_id: id for service object """ self.admin_clients("keystone").services.get(service_id) def _get_service_id(self, name): for i in self._list_services(): if i.name == name: return i.id

subject: Backwards compatiblity for auth_token middleware
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-26 00:26:37.000000000', 'files': ['lib/keystone'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/ac795be2b2d3cdea0dc3ed22cf4cc83625448575', 'message': 'Backwards compatiblity for auth_token middleware

Global requirements has keystonemiddleware>=1.0.0. But we configure
keystone auth_token with auth plugin which is only available from
1.3. With an older middleware, users will hit unauthorized errors
while stacking. I think we still need to support the legacy config
options until the minimum version is bumped up.

Change-Id: Ica62382ae113d857883c15a308126476a4fe9c9f
'}]
commit_message:
Backwards compatiblity for auth_token middleware

Global requirements has keystonemiddleware>=1.0.0. But we configure
keystone auth_token with auth plugin which is only available from
1.3. With an older middleware, users will hit unauthorized errors
while stacking. I think we still need to support the legacy config
options until the minimum version is bumped up.

Change-Id: Ica62382ae113d857883c15a308126476a4fe9c9f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/01/159301/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Backwards compatibility for keystonemiddleware<1.3 iniset $conf_file $section admin_tenant_name $SERVICE_TENANT_NAME iniset $conf_file $section admin_user $admin_user iniset $conf_file $section admin_password $SERVICE_PASSWORD

commit_message:
Break coupling between ML2 and L3 during delete operation

This is an initial attempt at breaking out the L3 logic from the ML2
framework as much as possible. This patch takes care of the notification
to the L3 agent(s), after a port has been deleted. Both base L3 and
L3+DVR operations are affected.

Related-blueprint: services-split
Related-blueprint: plugin-interface-perestroika

Change-Id: Ic41b87246ec4d89c2da49afaaccaeb8bd041dcb9

added_lines: from neutron.callbacks import exceptions def _pre_delete_port(self, context, port_id, port_check): """Do some preliminary operations before deleting the port.""" LOG.debug("Deleting port %s", port_id) try: # notify interested parties of imminent port deletion; # a failure here prevents the operation from happening kwargs = { 'context': context, 'port_id': port_id, 'port_check': port_check } registry.notify( resources.PORT, events.BEFORE_DELETE, self, **kwargs) except exceptions.CallbackFailure: # TODO(armax): add reason when change #153757 merges raise exc.ServicePortInUse(port_id=port_id) def delete_port(self, context, id, l3_port_check=True): self._pre_delete_port(context, id, l3_port_check) session = context.session # TODO(armax): get rid of the l3 dependency in the with block router_ids = [] self._post_delete_port( context, port, router_ids, removed_routers, bound_mech_contexts) def _post_delete_port( self, context, port, router_ids, removed_routers, bound_mech_contexts): kwargs = { 'context': context, 'port': port, 'router_ids': router_ids, 'removed_routers': removed_routers } registry.notify(resources.PORT, events.AFTER_DELETE, self, **kwargs)
deleted_lines: from neutron.extensions import l3agentscheduler def delete_port(self, context, id, l3_port_check=True): LOG.debug("Deleting port %s", id) if l3plugin and l3_port_check: l3plugin.prevent_l3_port_deletion(context, id) # now that we've left db transaction, we are safe to notify if l3plugin: if is_dvr_enabled: l3plugin.dvr_vmarp_table_update(context, port, "del") l3plugin.notify_routers_updated(context, router_ids) for router in removed_routers: try: l3plugin.remove_router_from_l3_agent( context, router['agent_id'], router['router_id']) except l3agentscheduler.RouterNotHostedByL3Agent: # router may have been removed by another process LOG.debug("Router %(id)s not hosted by L3 agent %(agent)s", {'id': router['router_id'], 'agent': router['agent_id']})

commit_message:
Fix incorrect variables in ansible role scripts

Both bootstap-ansible.sh and os-ansible-role-requirements.py had
variables that weren't correct. This change fixes both.

* bootstrap-ansible.sh now checks for ANSIBLE_ROLE_FILE rather than
hardcoding lookup for `ansible-role-requirements.yml`. For reference,
that file name is the default value for ANSIBLE_ROLE_FILE.
* os-ansible-role-requirements.py was checking the dirname of
the requirements_file argument directly, which is just a file name, not
a path. The `requirements_file` variable has the full path calculated
from the passed file name.

Change-Id: I2f035bc230b77c9dc4363a60ebe0436970fa8a7e
Closes-Bug: #1434139
Closes-Bug: #1434129
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/88/165888/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not os.path.isdir(os.path.dirname(requirement_file)): os.makedirs(os.path.dirname(requirement_file))

commit_message:
Revert "disable neutron network tests that fail too much"

This reverts commit 41a4ef4c586eec7a540d74b5360566f9263eed3b.

These tests were skipped back in October and we still see
the failures in test_server_connectivity_reboot.

To actually work on fixing this issue, we need to unskip
the tests that hit the failure most often but tie that to
nova changes which debug/fix the problem.

Change-Id: I007ced60a80ddbc04e04822e7575a6dc7083874c
Related-Bug: #1323658

commit_message:
Translated count filter for table footer

We normally display item count in the table footer. This patch adds a
directive to translate and include item count.

Partially Implemenents: blueprint angularize-identity-tables
Change-Id: Iee6d861dd3d283477014c68f728615a1b3ca438c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/71/165971/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: describe('itemcount', function() { it('should return translated text with item count', inject(function(itemcountFilter) { expect(itemcountFilter(null)).toBe('Displaying 0 items'); expect(itemcountFilter(undefined)).toBe('Displaying 0 items'); expect(itemcountFilter(true)).toBe('Displaying 1 item'); expect(itemcountFilter(false)).toBe('Displaying 0 items'); expect(itemcountFilter('a')).toBe('Displaying 0 items'); expect(itemcountFilter('0')).toBe('Displaying 0 items'); expect(itemcountFilter('1')).toBe('Displaying 1 item'); expect(itemcountFilter('1e1')).toBe('Displaying 10 items'); expect(itemcountFilter('1b1')).toBe('Displaying 0 items'); expect(itemcountFilter(0)).toBe('Displaying 0 items'); expect(itemcountFilter(1)).toBe('Displaying 1 item'); expect(itemcountFilter(1.2)).toBe('Displaying 1 item'); expect(itemcountFilter(1.6)).toBe('Displaying 2 items'); expect(itemcountFilter(-1)).toBe('Displaying 0 items'); expect(itemcountFilter(-1.2)).toBe('Displaying 0 items'); }) ); });

commit_message:
Reuse nova batch notifier

Refactor the batch notifier currently used by the Nova notifier
into a separate class. It will be reused when batching L3 HA
state change events.

Partially-Implements: blueprint report-ha-router-master
Change-Id: I2f8cf261f48bdb632ac0bd643a337290b5297fce

commit_message:
Add fail_loglevel to processutils.execute

It is useful to be able to log actual failures at a level like
logging.ERROR while leaving the rest of the logging in execute() at
a lower level, like logging.DEBUG.

This patch adds processing of the fail_loglevel kwarg and defaults
it to the loglevel setting to ensure no behavior change.

Change-Id: I6163e731688bfccc23996b5e7927d33bfd1d08f5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.concurrency refs/changes/42/145942/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :param fail_loglevel: log level for execute command failure messages. :type fail_loglevel: int. As in logging.ERROR. Defaults to loglevel. fail_loglevel = kwargs.pop('fail_loglevel', loglevel) LOG.log(fail_loglevel, format, {"desc": err.description, "cmd": err.cmd, "code": err.exit_code, "stdout": err.stdout, "stderr": err.stderr}) LOG.log(fail_loglevel, format, {"cmd": sanitized_cmd, "errno": err.errno})
deleted_lines: LOG.log(loglevel, format, {"desc": err.description, "cmd": err.cmd, "code": err.exit_code, "stdout": err.stdout, "stderr": err.stderr}) LOG.log(loglevel, format, {"cmd": sanitized_cmd, "errno": err.errno})

commit_message:
Mock unnecessary calls to conductor_api.build_instances()

Some tests make unnecessary calls to conductor_api.build_instances()
when the tests themself do not depend on instances being built.

This in turn results in threads completely out of control of the tests
that spawned them that generate random errors in logs.

Change-Id: I983f9477efc9c559e3df405c590df31683eef3d7
Partial-Bug: #1371587

commit_message:
Allow plugin to specify security-group rules ids upon creation

This patch enables plugin to specify the security-group rules ids,
it is optional and defaults to current behavior.
This approach is already used with network creation, where a plugin can
specify the network uuid.

Closes-Bug: #1434067
Change-Id: I034f0ffc2200f64926617e87861a97838e76342c

commit_message:
Adds ability to override service name for service catalog

Instead of forcing the name of the service in the service catalog to
match auth_name, this allows the ability to explicitly set the service
name, spearately from auth_name.
If service_name is not specified, it's value defaults to the value
of auth_name (which maintains the current behavior.)

Change-Id: Ie586b2892c092a9694b067a9e0f28f36396de30d
Closes-bug: #1359755
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/31/152031/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*service_name*] # (optional) Name of the service. # Defaults to the value of auth_name, but must differ from the value # of service_name_s3. # # [*service_name_s3*] # (optional) Name of the s3 service. # Defaults to the value of auth_name_s3, but must differ from the value # of service_name. # $service_name = undef, $service_name_s3 = undef, if $service_name == undef { $real_service_name = $auth_name } else { $real_service_name = $service_name } if $service_name_s3 == undef { $real_service_name_s3 = "${auth_name}_s3" } else { $real_service_name_s3 = $service_name_s3 } if $real_service_name == $real_service_name_s3 { fail('cinder::keystone::auth parameters service_name and service_name_s3 must be different.') } keystone::resource::service_identity { 'swift': service_name => $real_service_name, auth_name => $auth_name, keystone::resource::service_identity { "swift_s3": service_name => $real_service_name_s3,

commit_message:
Add Puppet 4.x lint checks

- This changes the puppet-lint requirement to 1.1.x, so that we can use
  puppet-lint plugins. Most of these plugins are for 4.x compat, but some just
  catch common errors.

Change-Id: Ic47d53384592637dd27c3d0851fe24861ee1ed81
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make user creation optional when creating service.

In some cases it is useful to be able to just configure
the service in Keystone and not the service user. This
is the case when e.g. a read only LDAP backend is used.
Added a parameter configure_user (defaults to true).

Change-Id: I610c9c238de9a1be0203a9dc5bb8845d3eb753ea
Closes-Bug: 1360232
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ironic refs/changes/23/166223/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*configure_user*] # (Optional) Should the service user be configured? # Defaults to 'true'. # # [*configure_user_role*] # (Optional) Should the admin role be configured for the service user? # Defaults to 'true'. # $auth_name = 'ironic', $email = 'ironic@localhost', $tenant = 'services', $configure_endpoint = true, $configure_user = true, $configure_user_role = true, $service_name = undef, $service_type = 'baremetal', $public_protocol = 'http', $public_address = '127.0.0.1', $admin_address = '127.0.0.1', $internal_address = '127.0.0.1', $port = '6385', $public_port = undef, $region = 'RegionOne' if $configure_user_role { Keystone_user_role["${auth_name}@${tenant}"] ~> Service <| name == 'ironic-server' |> } Keystone_endpoint["${region}/${real_service_name}"] ~> Service <| name == 'ironic-server' |> keystone::resource::service_identity { $auth_name: configure_user => $configure_user, configure_user_role => $configure_user_role,
deleted_lines: $auth_name = 'ironic', $email = 'ironic@localhost', $tenant = 'services', $configure_endpoint = true, $service_name = undef, $service_type = 'baremetal', $public_protocol = 'http', $public_address = '127.0.0.1', $admin_address = '127.0.0.1', $internal_address = '127.0.0.1', $port = '6385', $public_port = undef, $region = 'RegionOne' Keystone_user_role["${auth_name}@${tenant}"] ~> Service <| name == 'ironic-server' |> Keystone_endpoint["${region}/${real_service_name}"] ~> Service <| name == 'ironic-server' |> keystone::resource::service_identity { $auth_name: configure_user => true, configure_user_role => true,

commit_message:
Adds ability to override service name for service catalog

Instead of forcing the name of the service in the service catalog to match
auth_name, this allows the ability to explicitly set the service name,
spearately from auth_name. If service_name is not specified, it's value
defaults to the value of auth_name (which maintains the current
behavior.)

Change-Id: I4e7e122924ab56702ac325c6574a741ae905c70c
Closes-bug: #1359755
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ironic refs/changes/13/166213/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add ADMIN_USER_PASSWORD to genenv tool

The genenv tool was generating the wrong password for the openrc
file as a result of recent keystone rework.  This patch fixes that
problem.

Change-Id: I169e3255e3f3ef57938861c31ef4e342d9a32cbc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/71/166371/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ADMIN_USER_PASSWORD=<steakfordinner> - The admin user password

commit_message:
Move InstanceClaimTestCase.test_claim_and_audit

The resource tracker is being converted to use objects. This patch
removes InstanceClaimTestCase.test_claim_and_audit from
test_resource_tracker.py and adds equivalent tests to test_tracker.py.
By doing it this way, it can be seen that the old and new tests both
pass in the gate before the resource tracker is converted to use
migration objects.

Partially implements blueprint make-resource-tracker-use-objects

Change-Id: I7682fe86ebdecca10abad0f816e8b0c93cb498c5

added_lines: from nova.compute import claimsfrom nova import exceptionfrom nova.virt import hardwareMB2 = 2 * 1024 _INSTANCE_NUMA_TOPOLOGIES = { '2mb': objects.InstanceNUMATopology(cells=[ objects.InstanceNUMACell( id=0, cpuset=set([1]), memory=MB2, pagesize=0), objects.InstanceNUMACell( id=1, cpuset=set([3]), memory=MB2, pagesize=0)]), } _NUMA_LIMIT_TOPOLOGIES = { '2mb': hardware.VirtNUMALimitTopology(cells=[ hardware.VirtNUMATopologyCellLimit( 0, set([1, 2]), MB2, cpu_limit=1, memory_limit=MB2), hardware.VirtNUMATopologyCellLimit( 1, set([3, 4]), MB2, cpu_limit=1, memory_limit=MB2)]), } _NUMA_HOST_TOPOLOGIES = { '2mb': hardware.VirtNUMAHostTopology(cells=[ hardware.VirtNUMATopologyCellUsage( 0, set([1, 2]), MB2, cpu_usage=0, memory_usage=0), hardware.VirtNUMATopologyCellUsage( 1, set([3, 4]), MB2, cpu_usage=0, memory_usage=0)]), } host=None, # prevent RT trying to lazy-load this node=None, numa_topology=_INSTANCE_NUMA_TOPOLOGIES['2mb'], host=None, node=None,_COMPUTE_NODE_FIXTURE = { "id": 1, "service_id": 1, "hypervisor_hostname": "fake-node", "current_workload": 0, "running_vms": 0, "stats": {"num_instances": "0"}, "cpu_info": None, "numa_topology": None, "local_gb": 3, "local_gb_used": 0, "memory_mb": 384, "memory_mb_used": 0, "free_ram_mb": 384, "vcpus": 3, "vcpus_used": 0, } class TestInstanceClaim(BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestInstanceClaim, self).setUp() self._setup_rt() self.rt.compute_node = copy.deepcopy(_COMPUTE_NODE_FIXTURE) capi = self.cond_api_mock migr_mock = capi.migration_get_in_progress_by_host_and_node migr_mock.return_value = [] # not using mock.sentinel.ctx because instance_claim calls #elevated self.ctx = mock.MagicMock() self.elevated = mock.MagicMock() self.ctx.elevated.return_value = self.elevated self.instance = self._copy_instance() def _copy_instance(self, index=0): return copy.deepcopy(_INSTANCE_FIXTURES[index]) def assertEqualNUMAHostTopology(self, expected, got): attrs = ('cpuset', 'memory', 'id', 'cpu_usage', 'memory_usage') if None in (expected, got): if expected != got: raise AssertionError("Topologies don't match. Expected: " "%(expected)s, but got: %(got)s" % {'expected': expected, 'got': got}) else: return if len(expected) != len(got): raise AssertionError("Topologies don't match due to different " "number of cells. Expected: " "%(expected)s, but got: %(got)s" % {'expected': expected, 'got': got}) for exp_cell, got_cell in zip(expected.cells, got.cells): for attr in attrs: if getattr(exp_cell, attr) != getattr(got_cell, attr): raise AssertionError("Topologies don't match. Expected: " "%(expected)s, but got: %(got)s" % {'expected': expected, 'got': got}) def test_claim_disabled(self): self.rt.compute_node = None self.assertTrue(self.rt.disabled) claim = self.rt.instance_claim(mock.sentinel.ctx, self.instance, None) self.assertEqual(self.rt.host, self.instance.host) self.assertEqual(self.rt.host, self.instance.launched_on) self.assertEqual(self.rt.nodename, self.instance.node) self.assertIsInstance(claim, claims.NopClaim) @mock.patch('nova.objects.InstancePCIRequests.get_by_instance_uuid') def test_claim(self, pci_mock): self.assertFalse(self.rt.disabled) pci_mock.return_value = objects.InstancePCIRequests() pci_mock.return_value.requests = [] disk_used = self.instance.root_gb + self.instance.ephemeral_gb expected = copy.deepcopy(_COMPUTE_NODE_FIXTURE) expected.update({ 'local_gb_used': disk_used, 'memory_mb_used': self.instance.memory_mb, 'free_disk_gb': _COMPUTE_NODE_FIXTURE['local_gb'] - disk_used, "free_ram_mb": _COMPUTE_NODE_FIXTURE['memory_mb'] - self.instance.memory_mb, 'running_vms': 1, # 'vcpus_used': 0, # vcpus are not claimed 'pci_stats': '[]', }) with mock.patch.object(self.rt, '_update') as update_mock: self.rt.instance_claim(self.ctx, self.instance, None) update_mock.assert_called_once_with(self.elevated, expected) @mock.patch('nova.objects.InstancePCIRequests.get_by_instance_uuid') def test_claim_limits(self, pci_mock): self.assertFalse(self.rt.disabled) pci_mock.return_value = objects.InstancePCIRequests() pci_mock.return_value.requests = [] good_limits = { 'memory_mb': _COMPUTE_NODE_FIXTURE['memory_mb'], 'disk_gb': _COMPUTE_NODE_FIXTURE['local_gb'], 'vcpu': _COMPUTE_NODE_FIXTURE['vcpus'], } for key in good_limits.keys(): bad_limits = copy.deepcopy(good_limits) bad_limits[key] = 0 self.assertRaises(exception.ComputeResourcesUnavailable, self.rt.instance_claim, self.ctx, self.instance, bad_limits) @mock.patch('nova.objects.InstancePCIRequests.get_by_instance_uuid') def test_claim_numa(self, pci_mock): self.assertFalse(self.rt.disabled) pci_mock.return_value = objects.InstancePCIRequests() pci_mock.return_value.requests = [] self.instance.numa_topology = _INSTANCE_NUMA_TOPOLOGIES['2mb'] host_topology = _NUMA_HOST_TOPOLOGIES['2mb'] limit_topology = _NUMA_LIMIT_TOPOLOGIES['2mb'] self.rt.compute_node['numa_topology'] = host_topology.to_json() limits = {'numa_topology': limit_topology.to_json()} expected_numa = copy.deepcopy(host_topology) for cell in expected_numa.cells: cell.memory_usage += MB2 cell.cpu_usage += 1 with mock.patch.object(self.rt, '_update') as update_mock: self.rt.instance_claim(self.ctx, self.instance, limits) self.assertTrue(update_mock.called) updated_compute_node = update_mock.call_args[0][1] new_numa = updated_compute_node['numa_topology'] new_numa = hardware.VirtNUMAHostTopology.from_json(new_numa) self.assertEqualNUMAHostTopology(expected_numa, new_numa)

commit_message:
spec: updates for rspec-puppet 2.x and rspec 3.x

This patch aim to update our specs test in order to work with the
rspec-puppet release 2.0.0, in the mean time, we update rspec syntax
order to be prepared for rspec 3.x move.

In details:

 * Upgrade and pin rspec-puppet from 1.0.1 to 2.0.0
 * Use shared_examples "a Puppet::Error" for puppet::error tests *
 * Convert 'should' keyword to 'is_expected.to' (prepare rspec 3.x) *
 * Fix spec tests for rspec-puppet 2.0.0
 * Clean Gemfile (remove over-specificication of runtime deps of
   puppetlabs_spec_helper)

Change-Id: Ida94605916fe26dd4c5fb328f79c4e787d29dcf5
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2015-01-24 03:27:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/4aa9c7d7395c3bdee21da99acf1f185c0d525ef2', 'message': 'Move the assignment of existing_floating_ips before try block

In function _process_external() in agent/l3/agent.py, the call to
iptables_manager.defer_apply() may throw an exception, making a
later call to _update_fip_statuses() use an un-initialized value.
This will throw its own UnboundLocalError, with the result being
no iptables rules will be applied.

Added tests to cover both the defer_apply() code exception
processing, as well as this new case where we might jump to
_update_fip_statuses() without having done any work on floating
IP addresses.

Change-Id: I0045effc9319772127758be4aacca02ab5c236cd
Closes-Bug: #1413111

'}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2015-02-24 21:56:16.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_iptables_manager.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/iptables_manager.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/b117e8ec854dd0a26d04beb7e1effedffec3cb3a', 'message': 'Move the assignment of existing_floating_ips before try block

In function _process_external() in agent/l3/agent.py, the call to
iptables_manager.defer_apply() may throw an exception, making a
later call to _update_fip_statuses() use an un-initialized value.
This will throw its own UnboundLocalError, with the result being
no iptables rules will be applied.

Added tests to cover both the defer_apply() code exception
processing, as well as this new case where we might jump to
_update_fip_statuses() without having done any work on floating
IP addresses.

commit_message:
Move the assignment of existing_floating_ips before try block

In function _process_external() in agent/l3/agent.py, the call to
iptables_manager.defer_apply() may throw an exception, making a
later call to _update_fip_statuses() use an un-initialized value.
This will throw its own UnboundLocalError, with the result being
no iptables rules will be applied.

Added tests to cover both the defer_apply() code exception
processing, as well as this new case where we might jump to
_update_fip_statuses() without having done any work on floating
IP addresses.

Change-Id: I0045effc9319772127758be4aacca02ab5c236cd
Closes-Bug: #1413111

commit_message:
Rename compute response schema dir to v2_1

This commit rename the compute response schema directory to v2_1.
Further this directory will used to place all merged compute schema files
for V2.1 API.

Partially implements blueprint rearrange-nova-response-schemas

Change-Id: Ia9d9a147df3668d6dd76f0825676439676b43bee

commit_message:
Add sub_alarms column to select statement

Fix malformed dimension problem in find alarms resource.
Remove tenant_id, region, and id from dimensions for metric list.

Change-Id: I2df1d065d94c33c9598ecbf6ac1eb9225ec6b1ba

commit_message:
WIP: Lazy load outputs

TODO: tests

This implements lazy loading for outputs, such that the resolving of the
outputs are not done until a key access is required. The internal
representation is no longer translated, rather the outputs class is
passed the expected format for the differing template sections. The new
class tries to unite all output operations including getting elements
and validation.

Change-Id: I0440afbf354c90ce48fe739ae2da7dd150421a8e

commit_message:
Disable metadata in cloud-init config

Rather than deleting cloud-init, which is going to take longer, just
disable ec2 metadata service. This will be a no-op on rackspace, which
already does this.

Change-Id: I5e8baee50800f7aae474288a914333c21466855a

commit_message:
Adds Sheepdog description to storage decision document

Closes bug: #1390756

Change-Id: I8423c106ff06c6d906ab186aa1e4de38d72e931f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/operations-guide refs/changes/11/163011/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <varlistentry> <term>Sheepdog<indexterm class="singular"> <primary>Sheepdog</primary> </indexterm></term> <listitem> <para>Sheepdog is a userspace distributed storage system. Sheepdog scales to several hundred nodes, and has powerful virtual disk management features like snapshot, cloning, rollback, thin provisioning.</para> <para>It is essentially an object storage system that manages disks and aggregates the space and performance of disks linearly in hyper scale on commodity hardware in a smart way. On top of its object store, Sheepdog provides elastic volume service and http service. Sheepdog does not assume anything about kernel version and can work nicely with a xattr-supported file systems.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry>

commit_message:
Remove /var/log/mariadb from hostmount list

Remove /var/log/mariadb from hostmount list since it isn't
necessary to log to the host as specified in the dockerfile.

commit_message:
Starting to rework docs around the secret resource

This is the start of a reworking of our docs around the
secrets API. There will be a number of follow-up patches
before this document will be considered complete.
Until this document is considered complete, I'm not adding
this page to the table of contents. Also, to limit
individual CR size, I've tossed TODOs on the areas that
will be worked on in future CRs.

Change-Id: I8599628d51f4b5aae9ec1b8fd76f419d5b38bdcc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/59/165659/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ================================== Secrets Resource API Documentation ================================== The secrets resource is the heart of the Barbican service. It provides access to the secret / keying material stored in the system. Barbican supports the storage of data for various content-types securely. TODO(jvrbanac): Add more information about the secrets resource What is a secret ================= TODO(jvrbanac): Add a summary here Secret Attributes ----------------- +-----------------------+---------+-------------------------------------------------+ | Attribute Name | Type | Description | +=======================+=========+=================================================+ | Name | string | (optional) The name of the secret set by the | | | | user. | +-----------------------+---------+-------------------------------------------------+ | Expiration | string | (optional) This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 | | | | format ``YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.`` | +-----------------------+---------+-------------------------------------------------+ | Algorithm | string | (optional) Metadata provided by a user or | | | | system for informational purposes. | +-----------------------+---------+-------------------------------------------------+ | Bit Length | integer | (optional) Metadata provided by a user or | | | | system for informational purposes. | +-----------------------+---------+-------------------------------------------------+ | Mode | string | (optional) Metadata provided by a user or | | | | system for informational purposes. | +-----------------------+---------+-------------------------------------------------+ | Payload | string | (optional) The secret's data to be stored. Can | | | | be either 'text/plain' or 'application/octet- | | | | stream' . If provided, the field cannot be | | | | empty and 'payload_content_type' must also be | | | | supplied. | +-----------------------+---------+-------------------------------------------------+ | Payload Content Type | string | (optional) (required if payload is added) The | | | | type and format of the secret data. The two | | | | supported types are "text/plain" and | | | | "application/octet-stream". | +-----------------------+---------+-------------------------------------------------+ | Payload Content | string | (optional) The encoding used to format the | | Encoding | | payload provided. Currently only base64 is | | | | supported. This is required if content type | | | | provided has an encoding available. | +-----------------------+---------+-------------------------------------------------+ | Secret Type | string | (optional) Used to indicate the type of secret | | | | being stored. If no value is given, `opaque` is | | | | used as the default, which is used to signal | | | | Barbican to just store the information without | | | | worrying about format or encoding. | +-----------------------+---------+-------------------------------------------------+ API Workflow Examples ===================== How to create a secret ---------------------- TODO(jvrbanac): Add examples How to update a secret ---------------------- TODO(jvrbanac): Add examples How to retrieve a secret ------------------------ TODO(jvrbanac): Add examples How to delete a secret ---------------------- TODO(jvrbanac): Add examples API Reference ============= GET /secrets ------------ Lists a project's secrets. The list of secrets can be filtered by the parameters passed in via the URL. Parameters ^^^^^^^^^^ +--------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------+ | Name | Type | Description | +========+=========+================================================================+ | offset | integer | The starting index within the total list of the secrets that | | | | you would like to retrieve. | +--------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------+ | limit | integer | The maximum number of records to return (up to 100). The | | | | default limit is 10. | +--------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------+ | name | string | Selects all secrets with name equal to this value. | +--------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------+ | bits | integer | Selects all secrets with bit_length equal to this value. | +--------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------+ | alg | string | Selects all secrets with algorithm equal to this value. | +--------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------+ | mode | string | Selects all secrets with mode equal to this value. | +--------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------+ Response Attributes ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ +----------+---------+--------------------------------------------------------------+ | Name | Type | Description | +==========+=========+==============================================================+ | secrets | list | Contains a list of dictionaries filled with secret metadata. | +----------+---------+--------------------------------------------------------------+ | total | integer | The total number of secrets available to the user. | +----------+---------+--------------------------------------------------------------+ | next | string | A HATEOS url to retrieve the next set of secrets based on | | | | the offset and limit parameters. This attribute is only | | | | available when the total number of secrets is greater than | | | | limit parameter. | +----------+---------+--------------------------------------------------------------+ | previous | string | A HATEOS url to retrieve the previous set of secrets based | | | | on the offset and limit parameters. This attribute is only | | | | available when the request offset is greater than 0. | +----------+---------+--------------------------------------------------------------+ Error Codes ^^^^^^^^^^^ +------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | Code | Description | +======+=============================================================================+ | 401 | Invalid X-Auth-Token or the token doesn't have permissions to this resource | +------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ POST /secrets ------------- Creates a secret Attributes ^^^^^^^^^^ +--------------------------+---------+----------------------------------------------+ | Name | Type | Description | +==========================+=========+==============================================+ | name | string | Human readable name for the secret. | +--------------------------+---------+----------------------------------------------+ | expiration | string | This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format | | | | ``YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ``. If specified, the | | | | secret will no longer be available after | | | | this date. | +--------------------------+---------+----------------------------------------------+ | algorithm | string | | +--------------------------+---------+----------------------------------------------+ | bit_length | integer | | +--------------------------+---------+----------------------------------------------+ | mode | string | | +--------------------------+---------+----------------------------------------------+ | payload | string | | +--------------------------+---------+----------------------------------------------+ | payload_content_type | string | | +--------------------------+---------+----------------------------------------------+ | payload_content_encoding | string | | +--------------------------+---------+----------------------------------------------+ | secret_type | string | | +--------------------------+---------+----------------------------------------------+ TODO(jvrbanac): Finish this section GET /secrets/{uuid} ------------------- Retrieves a secret's metadata by uuid TODO(jvrbanac): Finish this section DELETE /secrets/{uuid} ---------------------- Delete a secret by uuid TODO(jvrbanac): Finish this section GET /secrets/{uuid}/payload --------------------------- Retrieve a secret's payload TODO(jvrbanac): Finish this section PUT /secrets/{uuid}/payload --------------------------- Update a secret's payload TODO(jvrbanac): Finish this section

subject: Fail deploy if root uuid or disk id isn't available
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-25 02:18:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/5f90ca51be5a075fbd0ff66977c1deda69bc51b3', 'message': "call set_failed_state if can not get root_uuid

ironic/drivers/modules/pxe.py#L471 will not raise exception if can not get
root_uuid, it just return, this will hang at 'deploying' state.

So in this patch, adds the call set_failed_state if root_uuid is none,
ironic will go head to exit the provision and set node to 'deploy failed'.

commit_message:
Fail deploy if root uuid or disk id isn't available

Makes the vendor passthrus pass_deploy_info of pxe
and ilo deploys to fail the deploy if root uuid or
disk id isn't available.

Closes-Bug: 1405519
Change-Id: Icb4771ad4ec2b8a32890e8324a9d23747225a909
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/19/143919/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: msg = _('Failed to get root_uuid.') LOG.error(_LE('Deploy failed for node %(nodes. ' 'Error: %(error)s'), {'instance': node.uuid, 'error': msg}) deploy_utils.set_failed_state(task, msg)

commit_message:
Fix validation of physical network name for flat nets

Fix validation of physical network name for flat nets for
the case when physical network names are not set.

Closes-bug: #1424548

Change-Id: Ibb64af48ff65ca515f48cfba176a89afc9103f1e

commit_message:
Bump CasperJS to 1.1-beta3 and simplify installation process

Now casperjs is managed by npm. Nothing seems to be broken.

Change-Id: I16684cd44376dfdaf4c683cdf2c93e1ff4903c3c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/05/166205/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update forge-upload job to use tags

For security, ignore the Rakefile in the repo itself, and replace
with a bare-bones file that can handle module:push.

Also replace the version entry in metadata.json with the contents
of the tag which triggered this run.

Change-Id: I0f5770dd92116cca2bcd6418733fc8faf45e1208

commit_message:
Validate MTU values at network creation

Commit 0225607ab9a9337914891e082adafc6199e0582a added support
for MTU. This patch ensures that the values set are valid.

If not then an exception will be raised and failure will not
occur at the dhcp agent when updating.

Change-Id: I1a14d58dfedd1fe1359a5190fd02395ea2f72bb6

commit_message:
Split grenade out of integrated-gate template

We are currently running grenade jobs on projects that grenade doesn't
test. As the first step to fix this, decouple the 'integrated-gate'
template with running of grenade.

Change-Id: I2f2e0d766735061dbd1f04e0ea63642a8723984b

commit_message:
Fixed severity level filtering

This fix includes a couple of fundamental changes to the way scores
are stored, as well as tweaks to to the reporting code. That
reporting code will be undergoing more optimization soon. Summary
of changes:

- Scores are now stored as a list, grouping score by severity
- report_JSON prototype changed to match other report_XXX functions
- report_JSON now handles the severity level filter
- report_JSON code cleaned up a bit
- "level" value in result_store is now a self value, and no longer
  passed around pointlessly
- JSON reporting stats now include a summary of issue counts for
  each severity (respects chosen severity filter)

Change-Id: Ie77142cf0ccf6ae32172f476e7662badaee39ebd

commit_message:
Move Pool NS Records to their own table

The provides part 1 of the Pools API changes discussed at the
mid cycle. Th majority of the remaining changes are new code/
objects rather than refactoring - so this change has been
split into it's own review.

Change-Id: I2291d76d36e8fcdeb8dffca855e7292d8cb22bfb

commit_message:
BarbicanHTTPException can take arguments for client_message

The BarbicanHTTPException used to only receive some string for the
message that would be sent back to the client with the error. This CR
enhances this exception and now you can give several arguments that
will end up formatting that message.

Change-Id: I9c78e352b914f5ca6a1e4fa2aa21dedb32aeba92
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/57/166257/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __init__(self, message_arg=None, client_message=None, *args, **kwargs): if not client_message: client_message = self.client_message try: self.client_message = client_message % kwargs except Exception as e: if _FATAL_EXCEPTION_FORMAT_ERRORS: raise e else: # at least get the core message out if something happened pass super(BarbicanHTTPException, self).__init__( message_arg, self.client_message, *args, **kwargs)

commit_message:
Fixes Keystone openrc and sets / for scripts

Previously, the keydtone openrc file was not using the proper
auth url, whcih was broken with too many double ticks. Also
changed the auth port from public to admin since keystone user
is an admin tenant. Changed DIR for scripts to align with the
rest of the project.

Change-Id: Iadde3239227e65ecca479b16a7b7db51d3a579c8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/23/166123/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ADD ./start.sh /start.sh ADD ./check.sh /check.shCMD ["/start.sh"]

commit_message:
Add support for multiple namespaces in Targets

In order for projects to use the namespace property of Targets
in a backwards compatible way (To support rolling upgrades),
a Target may now belong to more than a single namespace (i.e.
'namespace1' and None). This way, if the server is upgraded first,
the version that introduces namespaces to a project will place
the server RPC methods in ['some_namespace', None]. Pre-upgrade
agents will send messages in the null namespace while post-upgrade
agents will send messages in 'some_namespace', and both will be
accepted.

Change-Id: I713fe9228111c36aa3f7fb95cbd59c99100e8c96
Closes-Bug: #1430984
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/73/163673/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: and is referred to as the null namespace. A target may be a part of zero namespaces (namespace=None), one (namespace='namespace') or more (namespaces=['ns1', 'ns2', None]). Belonging to more than a single namespace should be avoided apart for supporting rolling upgrades. :type namespace: str or list of strings self.namespace = (namespace if isinstance(namespace, list) else [namespace])
deleted_lines: and is referred to as the null namespace. :type namespace: str self.namespace = namespace
